Description: The Office of Federal Contract Compliance Programs announced that federal contractor Parsons Brinckerhoff agreed to settle allegations of hiring discrimination on the basis of race and ethnicity involving 247 job applicants who were rejected for assistant engineer positions at the company's New York City headquarters.
Agency: Office of Federal Contract Compliance Programs

Description: Bechtel/Parsons Brinkerhoff, Bechtel Infrastructure Corp, PB Americas and 24 section design consultants agreed to pay a total of $447 million in settlement of criminal and civil liablities in the collapse of part of the I-90 tunnel and defects in the wall of the Tip O'Neill tunnel. Bechtel was to pay $357.1 million and Parsons $50 million, with the remainder to be paid by the consultants.
Notes: Company names and share of settlement paid are taken from documents attached to press release.
